metadata.synopsis: Mol has signed a deal with Raphael.She enjoys the power and wants to keep it to eventually run the Guildhall.
metadata.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_ATeleport to:S_LOW_Guildhall_Point_FetchersBrat_001aee7c92e-f8b8-4092-ac5e-667a21fc274aif you don't see Mol, use ReCon: oe Guildhall_Swap_Mol Talk to Mol

1.speaker: Mol
1.text: Talk to Sticky. Until I come to collect, our business is done.
1.context: NodeContext: Grim, angry - we told her that we killed her patron and she plans to get us back some day

27.speaker: Mol
27.text: Well, look who it is. Glad to see you in the city - hope you found plenty of coin in Ketheric's coffers.
27.context: NodeContext: A fond greeting - ribbing is as close to affection as she'll get

59.speaker: Mol
59.text: Well, look who it is. Looking to mess up my operation here, too? You'll find it a little harder than before.

60.speaker: Mol
60.text: So I'd suggest you just stick to business, yeah?

65.speaker: Mol
65.text: Welcome on, welcome all. You're looking at Fetcher's Brats, the Guildhall's finest.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Good to see you again. What are you up to this time?

53.speaker: Mol
53.text: Oh, I've got a few ideas. I'll be running this whole place in no time.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Somehow, this is just the kind of place I'd expect to find you.

13.speaker: Mol
13.text: You always were sharp, if a bit slow. Too big to be quick. But I'll stay out of your way if you'll stay out of mine.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Is this a Guild business you're running here?

29.speaker: Mol
29.text: What else? The Guildhall is still standing, even if Nine-Fingers isn't. Just means there's a chair to be filled.

30.speaker: Mol
30.text: Now if you're here for business, talk to Sticky. I don't deal directly with the customers.

57.speaker: Mol
57.text: That's right, specialising in pre-owned goods. You want to trade, talk to Sticky there. I'm in management. Busy, you know?

40.speaker: Mol
40.text: Sure is. We work for Fetcher, handling what you might call pre-owned goods. Talk to Sticky, he'll cut you a deal.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You're still trading? Aren't you concerned with the new management?

54.speaker: Mol
54.text: Please. The Zhentarim can hold the Guildhall - but that's not the same as holding the Guild itself.

16.speaker: Mol
16.text: Once they realise that, they'll be looking for a... mediator. Someone to speak for the crews. I'll be right here.

39.speaker: Mol
39.text: I survived the hells when Elturel fell. Compared to that, slipping out of Moonrise was child's play.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I found your eye patch at Moonrise. How did you escape that place?

38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol dons the eye patch

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I found the contract you signed with Raphael, Mol. Do you want it?

14.speaker: Mol
14.text: Give me that. Can't have this floating around loose. I thought I was meant to be the thief?
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard 'receive item out of shot' animation

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Is this how you survived the shadowlands? A deal with Raphael?

19.speaker: Mol
19.text: So what if it is? Choosing the right allies is just common sense. Even you'll make a friend or two eventually, I bet.

5.speaker: Mol
5.text: So what if it is? Choosing the right allies is just common sense. You wouldn't have made it this far on your own.

17.speaker: Mol
17.text: Big Raph doesn't own me - he's just giving me the tools to keep myself alive, and to take what I want.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Are you going to destroy it?

26.speaker: Mol
26.text: Why? Don't know about you, but I don't put my name to something I don't mean.

32.speaker: Mol
32.text: A pact is just another deal. He can call himself 'patron', but Big Raph doesn't own me - he's just giving me the tools to take what I want.

50.speaker: Mol
50.text: As for what that is, well... you didn't think I planned to stop at running the Fetcher's Brats, did you?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I hope you don't regret this, Mol.

12.speaker: Mol
12.text: Come find me when I'm running this whole Guild, and see how easily the gold wipes away any regrets I do have.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: There'll be no Guild to run if the city falls. Can I count on your help when the fighting begins?

7.speaker: Mol
7.text: I wouldn't miss it for the world. Baldur's Gate is home now, and the Brats are my family. Nobody messes with my family.

31.speaker: Mol
31.text: I'll leave the frontline hero work to the likes of you. We'll be here to pick up the pieces when you're done.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: There's a fight for the city's survival coming. When it does, lend me the power of your pact.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Raphael's dead, Mol. I killed him.

51.speaker: Mol
51.text: You... bloody idiot. You can kill half the devils in the hells for all I care - but Raphael was my patron. He made promises.

6.speaker: Mol
6.text: This is just a hiccup though. I'll still run this city one day, with or without Raph. And when I do, my Guild won't look on you too kindly.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I'm impressed. You saw an opportunity for power and you took it.

15.speaker: Mol
15.text: I knew you'd understand. Everyone's owned by somebody - might as well sign up to be on the winning team.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Make sure we're all on the winning team. There's a fight for the city's survival coming, and I'll need your help.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: This will end badly, Mol. Everyone who takes a devil's deal thinks they'll be in control.

58.speaker: Mol
58.text: You should know by now that I'm not everyone. If Raphael doesn't know that yet - he'll learn.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Show me what you're capable of. There's a fight for the city's survival coming - can I count on your help?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Why would you sign a deal with a devil?

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I killed Raphael. In Hell. He's gone for good.
